head.title: Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. - Page #4

body.p: << First Page | < Previous Page | Page #4 of 71 | Next Page > | Last Page >>

td.p: Mackintosh, Alexander. Schooner Nancy, Log and Lists of Provisions, 1811-1813. An electronic transcription. MFTP #0039

div.p: Remarks on board the Schooner Nancy hired Transport at anchor in the River Miamia in the Month of July 1813.
was returned, in consequence of which I order that in future any boat or craft after being three times hailed & no answer given, to fire on them[.]

Fore part of this day wind SW cloudy hazy weather at noon a squall from the Westward – men employed drawing yarns & knoting – Recd a waggon onboard – also some ammunition – go up to Headquarters, rumours of an expedition to Sandusky, latter part of the afternoon numbers of Indians go off, a council is held by several other Indian chiefs & our Gentlemen – wind at SW cloudy & cool weather – much dissatisfaction prevails among the Indians from no attempt being made to take Fort Meigs.

Fore part of this day partial showers or rain, wind SW go up to the Camp – preparing to come off, at 1 PM I return on board, the river is covered with Indians canoes going off, get under weigh & run for the Rivers mouth, came too for about 2 hours, it is determined to go to Sandusky few Indians follow, the whole of the 41st & artillery are distributed among the boats & Vessels – at 7 PM hove up & Sail for Turtle Island, the Chippeway, & Ellen in company at ½ past 10 came too about a cable length of Turtle Island in 2½ fathom water – set the watch – fresh breezes at WSW & Clear weather[.]

At day light got under weigh cut a Battoe adrift by order of the Genl took his own in tow, hove too several times, sent some letters on board a battoe bound for Amherstburg, ordered the Chippewa to send some boats to join the others of Turtle Island bore up & ran for Put in Bay, pleasant weather, wind SW at ½ past noon arrived at Put in bay canoe too with the small bower in 3½ fathom water handed all sails, the troops disembark for to take exercis[e.]

td.p:
L E G E N D :
in red , modifications made by the editor(s).
in lavender , modifications made by the assumed author(s).
